text:
theorists believe that the ratios of Fibonacci numbers are useful for estimating price
targets. For example, a down leg can be 1/2 or 2/3 the size of an up leg, or a price target
can be 13/18 of the previous high. Ratios of consecutive Fibonacci numbers converge
to 0.618 and 1.618 as the numbers in the sequence get larger. These two values are
commonly used to project price targets.
